annotation.spannedText: Call your veterinarian before you pick up your puppy and have him or her examined as soon as possible

classMention.mentionClass: Call your veterinarian before you pick up your puppy and have him or her examined as soon as possible

annotation.spannedText: it's best if you bring in the pup to the vet before you even go home for the first time

classMention.mentionClass: it's best if you bring in the pup to the vet before you even go home for the first time

annotation.spannedText: don't forget to bring in a stool sample for analysis (your puppy may have worms)

classMention.mentionClass: don't forget to bring in a stool sample for analysis (your puppy may have worms)

annotation.spannedText: Consult a veterinarian to learn what's best for your puppy. 6 to 7 weeks of age: Administer first combination vaccine (Distemper, Hepatitis, Parvovirus, Parainfluenza, Coronavirus)

classMention.mentionClass: Consult a veterinarian to learn what's best for your puppy. 6 to 7 weeks of age: Administer first combination vaccine (Distemper, Hepatitis, Parvovirus, Parainfluenza, Coronavirus)

annotation.spannedText: 9 weeks of age: Administer second combination vaccine

classMention.mentionClass: 9 weeks of age: Administer second combination vaccine

annotation.spannedText: 12 weeks of age: Administer the third combination injection and possibly a lyme vaccine inoculation

classMention.mentionClass: 12 weeks of age: Administer the third combination injection and possibly a lyme vaccine inoculation

annotation.spannedText: 16 weeks of age: Adminster the last combination vaccine

classMention.mentionClass: 16 weeks of age: Adminster the last combination vaccine

annotation.spannedText: Confirm with your veterinarian and check your local and state laws

classMention.mentionClass: Confirm with your veterinarian and check your local and state laws

annotation.spannedText: some breeds, such as Rottweilers and Dobermans, should have at least two Parvo vaccines with the last one being given at 20 weeks of age

classMention.mentionClass: some breeds, such as Rottweilers and Dobermans, should have at least two Parvo vaccines with the last one being given at 20 weeks of age
